text: William "Bill" G. Kaelin Jr. (born November 23, 1957) is an American professor of medicine at Harvard University and the Danaâ€“Farber Cancer Institute. His laboratory studies tumor suppressor proteins. Kaelin Jr. won the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 2019 with Peter J. Ratcliffe and Gregg L. Semenza. ==References== Category:1957 births Category:Living people Category:Educators from New York City Category:Scientists from New York City Category:Harvard University faculty
